# Concrete solutions

* Transparency: Open data, code and materials (replication & error detection)

* Good documentation

* Publication bias:
    * Registered reports
    * New journals that emphasize reproducibility
    * Journals for null-results & replications

* Post-publication commentaries: 
    * pubpeer.com
    * retractionwatch.com

* Science communication: Each study is a brick in a house we build

# Pre-registration

https://osf.io/w82ms/wiki/home/
* A plan, not a prison

* OSF infos: 
https://www.cos.io/initiatives/prereg

Why? 
- prevents p-hacking
- clearly distinguishes exploratory from confirmatory research
- works against publication bias
- Scooping doubts? Embargo possible. 


---

# Pre-registration in pratice

Where? 

* [As predicted](www.aspredicted.org): Short template
* OSF: Detailed template
* [ClinicalTrials.gov](http://clinicaltrials.gov)
* Economics/social sciences: [AEA	Registry](www.socialscienceregistry.org)
* Politics/governance: [egap](http://egap.org/content/registration)
* Any public, open-access repository with time-stamped version control
  * Github, figshare...
